channel.title: Dym on Simba Tango
channel.description: Recent content in Dym on Simba Tango

item.title: More De Caro
item.author: simbatango@gmail.com (Simba)
item.description: Danza y Movimiento have released anotherbatch of De Caro collections. In addition to the places they were available the last time, they are also available on Spotify (links below). I haven’t had time to listen carefully yet, but the few I have listened to seem to be transferred at the correct speed (unlike some of the older ones). Just in time for the upcoming día del tango. Enjoy: Mocosita (#153)

item.title: DyM Online | Tango Classics
item.author: simbatango@gmail.com (Simba)
item.description: by Todd Binger I decided to check out the offerings of DyM a bit more closely after I noticed that some of them were available in lossless format from the French site Qobuz. I got a couple of De Caro compilations because they are hard to get by other places. These tracks are mostly from the late 20s and early 30s, so what I found out may or may not apply to other, later recordings issued in this series.

item.title: Rare Tango Tracks Available in DyM's 'Tango Classics' Series
item.author: simbatango@gmail.com (Simba)
item.description: I just learnt that the German label Danza y Movimiento (DyM) are issuing a new series called Tango Classics. It is based on the collection of the collector Klaus Johns. There seems to be quite a few tracks not available elsewhere, for instance by Julio De Caro, so it should be worth checking out for all you serious collectors out there :-) Also listed at tango.info. Unfortunately, they only offer mp3 downloads at the time, flac or some other lossless option would be very nice.
